title: How to Make Lemon or Lime Water

steps.title: Wash 2 lemons or 3 large limes.
steps.content: Wash 2 lemons or 3 large limes. Remove any stickers from the fruit and place the citrus on a small cutting board. Use a small knife to carefully slice the fruit into thin slices. You may want to discard the ends of the fruit as well as any seeds.

steps.title: Gently squeeze the lemons (and limes, if you're using them) so they release a little juice and essential oil directly into the chilled pitcher.
steps.content: Gently squeeze the lemons (and limes, if you're using them) so they release a little juice and essential oil directly into the chilled pitcher. Don't squeeze them so much that the slices lose their round shape. Place all of the slices in the pitcher. [1] X Research source

steps.title: If you'd like still water, pour in 2 quarts (1.9 liters) of cold, filtered water.
steps.content: If you'd like still water, pour in 2 quarts (1.9 liters) of cold, filtered water. If you'd like sparkling water, pour in 1 quart (0.9 liters) of seltzer water. Use a long-handled spoon to stir the citrus slices with the water. [2] X Research source For sparkling water, you'll add another quart of seltzer just before serving.

steps.title: Put the pitcher of citrus water into the refrigerator.
steps.content: Put the pitcher of citrus water into the refrigerator. Chilling the water will infuse it with the lemon and lime flavors while making it colder. Chill the water for 2 to 4 hours. [3] X Research source Keep in mind that the flavors of the water will be stronger the longer it chills.

steps.title: Scoop out the lemon slices and consider straining the lemon water through a mesh sieve if you notice seeds.
steps.content: Scoop out the lemon slices and consider straining the lemon water through a mesh sieve if you notice seeds. If you want sparkling lemon water, add one more quart (0.9 liter) of seltzer water to the pitcher.Pour the citrus water into serving glasses. Add a few fresh slices of lemon or lime and ice cubes before you serve the drinks. [4] X Research source Store the lemon water for up to 2 days in the refrigerator. You can add fresh water to the sliced lemons that you removed from the pitcher, but the second batch of citrus water may not be as flavorful.

steps.title: Add a pop of color and bright flavor to your lemon water by adding a handful of fresh berries to the pitcher.
steps.content: Add a pop of color and bright flavor to your lemon water by adding a handful of fresh berries to the pitcher. Wash the fruit carefully, and if any stems remain, remove them. You can also slice fresh fruit and add it to the pitcher. Consider adding: Strawberries Pineapple Fresh berries (blueberries, blackberries, raspberries) Oranges Peaches or plums Melon (watermelon, cantaloupe, honeydew)

steps.title: You can easily make cucumber lemon water by thinly slicing and adding cucumber to your citrus water.
steps.content: You can easily make cucumber lemon water by thinly slicing and adding cucumber to your citrus water. The cucumber will stay crisp for hours and can add a refreshing flavor to the water. For a slightly spicy kick, consider slicing jalape√±os and adding them to the lemon water.

steps.title: Make your lemon water interesting by adding fresh herbs before chilling the water.
steps.content: Make your lemon water interesting by adding fresh herbs before chilling the water. Gather a handful of fresh herbs and rub them a little between your fingers. This will release flavorful oils. Remember to wash the herbs before you use them. Try mint, basil, lavender, thyme, or rosemary. You can also add hibiscus flower which will turn the water a soft pink color.

steps.title: If you dislike the strong flavor of lemon water, you may want to sweeten it a little before you drink it.
steps.content: If you dislike the strong flavor of lemon water, you may want to sweeten it a little before you drink it. Keep in mind that adding other fruits (such as strawberries or pineapple) can naturally sweeten the citrus water. Stir in a little honey according to your taste. You could also use agave nectar or stir in grated ginger to mask the sour flavor of the water.
